infobox: removed funk metal as it lacks an article
again, [[England]] is more accurate, as there were no heavy metal pioneers in [[Scotland]]/[[Wales]]/[[Northern Ireland]]
/* Recent trends: mid-late 2000s */ Wikipedia is not a reliable source.
/* New fusions: 1990s and early 2000s */ removing POV statement
change guitar to electric guitar, and bass to electric bass in infobox. Also remove (occasional) from after keyboards, as the article states that keyboards are used in HM to add fullness to the sound
removed a double mention of progressive metal

The term dissonance refers to intervals. not to sound effect. The use of dissonance (along with the link) is here improper. Also note the source doesn't use the term "dissonance"

/* Mainstream: late 1970s and 1980s */ make bret smaller
/* Power metal */ I think the section should start with text, not the photo
/* Black metal */ I felt "co-option" might not be clear...lengthened by a few words, switched to more common word "co-opted
/* Black metal */ add details to caption
/* See also */ remove the Umlaut...this is not a major article,nor a major issue...the "see also" articles should be major, relevant articles
/* Black metal */ made bigger, add more to caption
/* Black metal */ add free CF pic
/* Mainstream: late 1970s and 1980s */ still too big
/* Mainstream: late 1970s and 1980s */ Oops..BM pic was too big
/* Mainstream: late 1970s and 1980s */ Great free pic of Bret Michaels in glam gear (nail polish!) ...ahh, 1980s "hair metal"!
/* Visual elements */ Beefcake the Mighty pic too big
/* Characteristics */ gloss mellotron...not a joke..the keyboard is based around magnetic tapes that are played back
Oops...it was too high, even before opening sentences
Add free pic from Wikimedia Commons...while the band is not well-known, it nevertheless captures a number of key metal elements..long hair, Marshall stacks, flying V, etc
/* Visual elements */ add details to pic caption

/* Rhythm and tempo */ make score bigger

/* Visual elements */ add studded wristband..free image
/* Characteristics */ add WikiCOmmons free photo, to illustrate a 2000s-era metal drumkit (double bass, variety of cymbals)
/* Physical gestures */ Add WikiCOmmons free image of fans making devil horns hands at metal show in 2006
/* Rhythm and tempo */ join sentences into paragraph

I'm sorry but the term "dissonance" is not mentioned in your source as far as I can see. In theory, the term dissonance refers to Relations between intervals. So it is misguiding to use it here.
All Music Guide has now been rebranded to Allmusic using [[Project:AutoWikiBrowser|AWB]]
/* Harmony */ add in reference on intermodulation distortion, as promised on talk page

/* Harmony */ reword the power chord discussion, try to make it clearer. Also, add in the other issue: intermodulation distortion (frequencies that are sums and differences of input, thus not harmonic
/* Characteristics */ add "overdriven"...while clear to those who know about HM, those new to the style may need to be informed
